casebody.data:
Ronny G. AVERY, Respondent,
v.
George WHITE, Jr., and In Season Enterprise, LLC, Appellants. No. ED 106230 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION ONE. Filed: October 16, 2018
Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied November 19, 2018 FOR APPELLANT: Richard J. Magee, 200 South Hanley Road, Ste.500, Clayton, MO 63105. FOR RESPONDENT: Connie L. McFarland-Butler, 923 N. Hwy 67, Florissant, MO 63031. Before Roy L. Richter, P.J., Robert M. Clayton III, J., and Angela T. Quigless, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

George White, Jr. and In Season Enterprise, LLC (collectively "Defendants") appeal the judgment, entered after a bench trial, awarding Ronny G. Avery ("Plaintiff") $21,235.89 on Plaintiff's claim for fraudulent transfer of marital property. We find no error has occurred.

No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. We have, however, provided the parties a memorandum setting forth the reasons for our decision. The judgment of the trial court is affirmed under Rule 84.16(b). 1

We deny Plaintiff's motion to dismiss Defendants' appeal, which was taken with the case.
